p: 2) The language in the conclusion, as mentioned, needs to be toned way down. Although I appreciate and understand the need to have a way forward with respect to research, for those of us involved in the response to this epidemic, clearly, everyone recognizes the need to strengthen surveillance in the region, and the authors need to be careful in terms of how the conclusion is framed so as not to imply that this is somehow not recognized. I would strongly suggest that they take another stab at the conclusion and also make reference to several of the very nice perspective pieces in the NEJM that have been ongoing.
